comments:
F2

0. Fresh install of My Product version 1.0.0 based on F2 build; fresh workspace
(The product installer is available internally on walleye in va2000 
outgoing/jeem/eclipse-product-1.0.0.exe)
This product is based on Eclipse Platform (Windows); it does not contain
JDT.

1. Start My Product
2. Help Contents

Observer: Separate window opens containing an error message (below).

Expectation: This should work.

=============

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-

We will need to investigate. The JDT compiler is used to compile JSP's, but 
help is built with pre-compiled JSP's, so theoretically there shouldn't be a 
need to do any jsp compilation. Just running a platform build (so, no JDT) 
works fine.

What is different between a platform build and your scenario?

Jeem,

The problem is caused by incorrect packaging of the org.eclipse.help.webapp 
plugin. Its WEB-INF directory appears in lower case in the product build. It 
should be upper case, as it is a J2EE standard directory for a web application.

Thanks for tracking this down. I will find out how the installer screwed up
"WEB-INF" as "web-inf". Closing.
